storyInfo: Santalla comes across her former people while helping the Infected who were migrating south with their clan. Once again, she leaves her past behind her, and the plight of the Ursus strengthens her resolve to find another way to save Sami.

attributes.content: Well... we're almost at the coordinates, if a bit off.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I predicted their migration route; if we can't find anyone at the objective point, they might be somewhere closer to the coordinates.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Sweet Spring and Shroomwood are both Samifjod clans with trees, and when a clan tree moves, you can't miss it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Did you hear that, Norma? You have much to learn from Santalla.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah...
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: If I could finish a five day journey in four, I wouldn't have been dismissed from the army in the first place.
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: Actually, I may have rushed us a bit, but I was overanxious...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It's not your fault. Circumstances in Sami are complex these days. Our expedition is going north, and so are most of Sami's warriors, but the clans are heading the opposite.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: At least this time we have their permission to tend to their Infected during the migration. That shows how much they trust us, so a little exhaustion is a small price to pay.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Santalla presses her head close to the communicator, but can't hear anything aside from the static.
She is almost certain Ursus has already blocked the signal, but she has brought it anyway.
As long as she can get any intel on them, then the communicator is more than scrap metal.
Er, are we almost there?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: The treetops in the forest are moving. It has to be the Samifjod who requested assistance.
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: Who's there?!
Greetings... Sweet Spring warrior.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: How did you know—You're a shaman?
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: A crest can tell a lot, honorable warrior.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: You're the one signaled for aid, I presume?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It was my sister. She's currently coordinating the clans, and couldn't take the time to come out and greet everyone. Apologies.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: Our top priority is attending to the Infected. We can save the pleasantries for once we've arrived.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Thank you, right this way then.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: The Infected from the various Sami clans are all here.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: Faye, could you gather the other operators to do a basic check-up on everyone here?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Certainly.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Norma, get over here and translate for us!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Alright, alright... I'm coming...
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: They seem like they're... expecting a war...
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: Dealing with the illness has always been a war without smoke.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I agree.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: It seems my sister was right, letting you people help us. Given how little we know about the disease, there could have been disputes in the clans over the treatment if you were not here.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: When I first arrived, I saw four Canopies moving. I presume there arefour clans migrating this time?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: But the number of people here seemed to be off. Even if these are four great clans, they couldn't possibly have this many people.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: If only it were just the four clans...
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: Seven, my Sami sister, there are seven clans here.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: Among them are two clan Snowpriests who answered Eikthyrnir's call before bringing warriors and clan trees with them up north.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: They're bringing the clan trees?! Would Sami allow that?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Only Sami herself can tell...
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: In short, this place is in chaos.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: At least we still have five clan trees with us in the center. That way we're able to rest easy at night.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: Five?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yes, five.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: The Colddeath clan tree is still young, so its Canopy hasn't grown past the forest roof. You could have missed it on your way here.
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Sami Warrior

attributes.content: No, it's nothing.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The people of the Colddeath clan... Where are they?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (In Sami) No need to fear, your symptoms are still minor. But you should avoid picking at the lesions. It won't do anything besides making you feel worse.
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: (In Sami) Yes, regularly taking shots and medication can keep your condition from worsening.
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: (In Sami) Why would I lie to you? Look, I'm also Infected.
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: The Originium assimilation of these infected isn't looking too bad, and the medicine we brought should suffice. Once the support arrives, the Samifjod can have a portion of our rations.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Where's Santalla?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (Glances at their watch)
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Norma, have you seen Santalla?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (Sami Language) Right, just take this medicine and you should be fine. You don't need any incantation or shaman's ritual.
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: Yes, what is it?!
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: I said, have you seen Santalla?!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: She just finished speaking with the Samifjod who's hosting us, and walked towards the edge of the crowd!
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: Why, is something wrong?!
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: Never mind, you do your work!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (Is she... looking for her clan?)
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (But isn't Santalla...)
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: How long had it been since she left them? Years, maybe over a decade?
Her discontent and disappointment have dissipated, melted down into a trickle of nostalgia.
She still faintly remembers a few familiar faces, and some of the clans' customs and traditions.
The warmth and beauty from her past still echoes in her memories. It's just...
Greetings.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I haven't seen you before, vina.
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: Would the warriors of the clan recognize the daughter of snowstorm?
Which clan are you from?
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: She has always been honest with people, no matter friend or foe.
But today, she is doomed to spew lies.
We're just outsiders passing by, tasked with delivering a message.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is your clan leader here?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: She's still in her tent. I can take you to her.
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: What should I call you, vina?
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: Please, call me Santalla.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Santalla, that's a nice name.
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: This way.
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Once, she resented her people for forsaking the old tree.
Now, she is the one forsaken by her people.
She walks past her clansmen. Familiar faces now look at her with unfamilar eyes.
They are curious about this 'outsider.'
Who, in magnificent clothes and holding a steel staff in hand, walks among the children of Sami.
No one could recollect, since there's nothing to recollect.
Forsaken. Forgotten.
This is the place. Please wait while I go inform.
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: Come on in.
attributes.name: Colddeath Warrior

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I welcome your visit, vina. What can I do for you?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: You are...Eras's granddaughter?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: That I am.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: I remember the interim clan chief being your brother. What happened to him?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: He...
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: My brother went along with Eikthyrnir's march towards the north. I act as clan leader on his behalf for the moment.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: And who exactly are you, if I may ask?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: The forsaken child, rescued by the branches of the old tree. Daughter of the Santalla tree. Do these words ring a bell to you?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Forsaken, you say...
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: I'm truly very sorry... I only remember the ceremony where we bid the old tree farewell. Everything about our days when it yet lived, or the people we've lost, they are beyond me.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: She, too, belongs to the past now.
Just like the old tree.
...It's alright.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: So I take it the business about delivering a message was an excuse?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: I do apologize...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I don't blame you. My clan has experienced so much displacement, and much was lost, including out past with people like you.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: If there's anything you need, just say the word.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: She honestly hopes that others might remember her, but what would happen if they do?
What would an outcast of the past change?
The wind of Sami has taken with it her story...
Let it leave, then, along with her regret.
You would excuse my rudeness, Alma of the birchbranch.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I am an outcast of Colddeath, daughter of the Santalla tree, Simone. By our rules and customs, I should never have returned to the clan.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: But I still want do something for the clan before I leave.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: If, of course, you would allow it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: How do you know my name?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: I... I see.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: You were... a part of the clan.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: As you can see, we are still in the midst of migrating, and there have been trivial issues that require our attention along the journey. However, we have been able to manage, thus they need not concern you.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: But our home... I'm talking about where we lived after mvoed to the woodlands. We were unable to hold a ceremony to comfort our ancestors before we left there.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: Because of the disaster in the north?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yes... Certain phenomena were about to polute our shelter, so we were in a hurry to leave.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: Our clan still doesn't have a new Snowpriest, and our shamans are feeble against the disaster.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: You're also a shaman, aren't you?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: I am capable of performing a shaman's duties, yes.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Then may I entrust you with this matter?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: You will not be disappointed.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I'm very sorry, daughter of the Santalla tree. You offer your earnest assistance while we fail to recognize our sister.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: It doesn't matter anymore, Alma. We all ought to leave stories from the past behind us.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Farewell then, leader of the Colddeath clan.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: May we meet at the other side of Sami's spine.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: A strange one indeed. Perhaps she was once Grandpa's student?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: If Grandpa were still here, he'd probably ask me to be confident and humble a leader as her.
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: (Pulls out the amber pendant that she carries with her)
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: If you had came across something like this, how would you deal with it?
attributes.name: Colddeath Shaman

attributes.content: The shaman stares in a trance at the pendant left to her by a departed friend. A gift she got as a child, from a young apprentice shaman she used to play with.
She still remembers that she was a Feline.
And her eyes were exactly like the visitor just now...
Ah, Santalla, you're back.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: You have enough hands here?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: We'll manage.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Then I have something else to attend to.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Some clansmen reported that the collapsal paradigm was approaching where they lived at the time. If the collapse has been heading where we are now, it will be a problem.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I need to look into it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Are you going alone? Isn't that... risky?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Having more untrained hands isn't goin to help.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I was trained as a shaman. I know how to handle corruption, and I'm the only one here with the power to solve it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It will be fine.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I should report this to the office right now, at least. They need to send a few shamans, preferably Snowpriests, to come help us.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: There's also Typhon. After she returns with the expedition team, she needs to to go take a look there.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Where is the last expedition team set off now?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: They should have made their way across the forest as we're talking. It's just some mountain paths they will have to walk before they enter the icefield.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Then we need to contact them. Better safe than sorry.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I'm already making calls.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Well then... take care on your journey, Santalla.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: My apologies for the additional workload I just imposed on you.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It's no problem at all.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Did Santalla leave already?
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: Dude, you sound like you've never worked with her before..
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Sami's oddities are still way out of our league. It's not like we can solve anything without troubling her.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: How are the Infected doing?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: They are being very cooperative and calm. For the time being there's nothing that demands our attention.
attributes.name: Scout Operator

attributes.content: Phew....That's good to hear.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Then I need to ask you to lend a hand, Norma. We need to send an urgent telegram to Čappat.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: A few days later...
This is the place.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is there a signal here?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Operates the communicator)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Might not be the signals...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Demons?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Naturally, there is no response. A giant shadow somewhat resembling a clan tree approaches.
The shadow of Colddeath's clan tree is wandering about in daylight?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: No prominet signs of hostility, but definitely not peaceful
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: This is an omen of disaster.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Let's give the Columbian way a try...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Next up is...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Takes out a mini calculator)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Presses a few buttons without looking at the numbers)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The results are completely inconsistent...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: As long as the corruption lingers, any solution is futile.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: O ancestral spirits of Colddeath, pray forgive my neglect.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I will be back soon.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Without a clan tree, there's no sanctuary from the corruption.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: In that case... the old tree shall shelter its people one last time.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Santalla takes out a dead twig of the old tree—her last tribute to it. She cuts her own finger, and the blood drips onto the dry twig before falling into the ground.
Heed me, O the Eternal, and return the unfaltering tranquility to the land.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: When Santalla's blood hits the ground, it turns into clear water. Under the influence of her Arts, it quickly turns to frost and spreads.
Clean frost swarms over the dead branch, which seizes the chance to burrow into the earth, attracting the gaze of the past.
The gray fog shrouding the rising moon begins to disperse. However, the vegetation still grows gradually more yellow and listless.
The past is both a blessing and a curse.
Not good enough...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Santalla looks around before landing her eyes where the clan tree has taken roots.
She picks up some twigs and leaves. Untainted by the corruption, Sami’s primal vitality lives on within them.
These will suffice.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Branches, both old and new, are woven together, and crushed tender leaves are scattered on the ground.
Through Santalla’s ritual, they have become the symbols of her intent.
Arbora, Soknarferd.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: May the past tie to the present, whilst the tree erects tall.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: May the eyes ever keep vigil, be they standing or fallen.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: All-Father, spirits of ancestors, souls who roam upon the earth.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Bear witness.... Bear witness to me!
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Heed and answer the plea of Simone, daughter of the Santalla tree.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Cleanse the land of its filth, and bring back Sami's purity!
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Twigs entwine into 'Arbora,' and leaves patrol on 'Soknarferd.'
The proclamations that answer only the beckons of Foldartals now manifest at the call of the shaman's call.
The collapse ceases in an instant, and nature begins to regain its former vitality.
However, at the edge of the forest, a dense dark fog refuses to disperse.
This pestilence  and the source of most of Sami's corruption.
The Black Mark...!
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Heavy breathing sounds)
Within an instant, the snow and ice around Santalla coagulate into a sharp blade darting at the figure.
An Emperor's Blade can finish off any unprepared challenger in a blink of eye.
And in the face of a Demon-taken Blade, her chance is even grimmer.
*Pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: She can choose to press on her attack, which would only send more Demon escaping from the enemy before her.
But if nothing is done, it would butchered all life around them, corrupt the earth, and trample over every inch of Sami land.
Even though the blessings summoned by the Foldartal are still in effect, Santalla still had to consider the calamity each attack would bring.
This isn't a battle.
And she is relieved for the fact.
The Black Mark staggers forward, stepping out and taking an offensive stand.
However, with its next step it disappears into thin air right before her eyes.
Under nature's purification, the collapsal had vanished without a trace.
It ran away?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: But that's...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is there anything I can do to help?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Not yet, we just spoke to the Rhodes Island operators in Skarphaket. They coordinated with members of an expedition team that had just set off, and sent them sufficient support.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Where is the last expedition team set off now?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: They should have made their way across the forest as we're talking. It's just some mountain paths they will have to walk before they enter the icefield.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: They were near the location of the expedition team, and though calamities appear unpredictably, there are always omens...
For example...
If there is more life, more beings returning to nothingness.
I'm going to have to let Typhon know at once.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: O noble Sami, please forgive me my transgression.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Santalla lifts her staff and plunges it into the earth.
The frost on the ground forms shapes as she wills.
Enginna... Enginna...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: O Sami, I know you watch over their fate.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Please take this omen, and send it to my friend.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Following her request, the pattern of ice rapidly disperses, and the ground is once again as dry as ever.
Everyone's safety depends on you, Typhon.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I... still have more I was entrusted with.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Santalla had hunted a hornbeast and picked some fruit.
These were to be presented as sacrificial offerings to the ancestors.
It wasn't much, but it would suffice to comfort the Colddeath ancestors.
Father, Mother, Snowpriest Eras, and all the ancestors.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: By the will of the clan leader, I come here to offer up these sacrificial offerings to you.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: May the ancestors protect our people, care for their restless hearts, and guide their way in their dreams.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I also hope...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: That people will remember you. That you will be spared the worry of being forgotten.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I look forward to it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: With a burst of flame, the sacrificial offerings disappear into the fire and enter the food basket of the ancestors.
All throughout the night, Santalla stares at the flames. Once they've burnt out, she slowly falls asleep.
Huh?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: This order is being sent to all search teams. An area believed to be damaged by Obsidian was discovered. Nearby teams are requested to act immediately. Confirm the reports at the specified coordinates and withdraw. Do NOT enter the damaged area.
Repeat, do NOT—
Obsidian?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: That's the direction the Black Mark came from.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The Ursus are still hiding something!
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Santalla glances at the sacrificial site and where the Foldartals had appeared.
The offerings had been reduced to ash, the living and dead branches were still entwined.
She thinks for a moment, then scatters a handful of ash over the roots of the branches.
Then, she leaves the woodlands towards the direction indicated by the Ursus.
She would never return.
These are the coordinates.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It's already deep in the icefields. What could the Ursus be planning?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I can feel the corruption in this place...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is it... here?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Fierce snowstorms shroud the area, as if trying to hide something.
But before Santalla's will, the snowstorm seems to dissipate.
It finally unveils the truth within:
Three Royal Guards, wrapped in Dominion.
Fear grips her soul for a moment, and something seems to come back from the void, ready to turn its sights on her location.
However, the snowstorm blows in just in time, shrouding her in its winds.
(Corrupted or not, they could have killed me then and there.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (What happened here?)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: She composes herself and waits until her mood has steadied before stepping out of the snowstorm. Then she walks towards the edge of the Dominion.
At its center, the three Royal Guards remain motionless.
This time, she can see them clearly.
Each of them had pierced their own hearts with an Ursine sabre.
Maybe it was Originium Arts, maybe some kind of spell.
Their bodies hadn't been blown over by the winds, nor were they used by demons.
They maintained the posture of their final moments, before being engulfed by their own Dominion.
Santalla then notices that they are positioned as if there were four of them, standing back-to-back before they were killed.
In the empty space, there is only an Ursine saber stuck in the snow.
Is this where you came from, Black Mark?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The great deeds of the Ursus were far outweighed by their evil ones.
But here, at least, what these heroes had done with their lives was more than enough to move the Samifjod.
(Sami had no other intentions. The snowstorms protect this place to guard these people in their sleep.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (I salute you, warriors.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (The Ursus aren't far from here.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (I'll remove the snowstorms, so you can safely return home.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: At the same time, however, there is something on her mind.
(So even the collective acts of the entire Ursus war machine can only end like this...)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Eikthyrnir, when you tore apart Sami's clans and gambled the future of the Samifjod on a hopeless expedition, did you ever think about the consequences?)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Sami promised you I would not interfere.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (But I am also a part of Sami.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (I will use my own methods, and together with my allies from the south, we will win a better future for Sami.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: All-Father, please bear witness to my resolve.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: O snowstorm, follow me, and leave these heroes to their attendants.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: In my next life, I will offer wine to the ancestral spirits among the branches and leaves.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Farewell, souls of the Ursus.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: She disappears into the blizzard, and it dissipates shortly after.
It wasn't long before the Ursus sounded their horns on the icefields.
Two weeks later...
I'm back.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: S-Santalla!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Wh-What's wrong? Why are you so nervous?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: You've been gone for so long! Any longer and I would've reported to the landship that you went MIA!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Am I not back now?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I know you're dealing with a lot of things. But next time, please help me prepare myself, mentally. What would we do if you disappeared one day?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Okay, it's my fault, I'm sorry Faye.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Don't think you can get out of this with just an apology...
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I'll make you some roasted hornbeast, alright?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Roasted hornbeast?!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Are we settled, then?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Hmph... Seeing how you're being so sincere, I'll overlook it just this once.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Thank you, Faye, you're a true friend.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: F-Flattery will get you nowhere.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Hehe.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Ah right, has the expedition team returned yet?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Ah... Of course, no one told you.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: The expedition team ran into some trouble before entering the icefields. Some sort of horrible monster, like the ghost of an Ursus officer or something.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Luckily, Typhon was prepared, and everyone withdrew in time. Otherwise there would be casualties. Which, well, would be hard to explain.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I see, that's good to hear.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: What about the clans who migrated south?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: They found a place to settle down. The Infected, if they so wish, can still live with their clan and visit Rhode's Island's Sami clinic for treatment.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Oh, that's good.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Then I have nothing to worry about.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Ah, Santalla, where are you heading this time?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Just back to the dorms to take a nap.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Oh, so even you know how to rest. Finally.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Then tomorrow we'll visit Skarphaket and meet up with Magallan and Typhon.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I take it back, you're unstoppable.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: This is what every Sami shaman... what every Rhodes Island operator should be doing, no more and no less.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: If I worked as hard as you, I'd be sent to Medical within a month.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I know this work is important, but that's all the more reason to balance it out with proper rest.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: And to me, taking a nap here is proper enough.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: That's not going to cut it, you really need get some sleep.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: We can save the rest for tomorrow.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Now go on, go.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Fine, fine, I'll rest.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Thank you, Faye.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Sweet dreams, Santalla.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Yes, goodnight.
attributes.name: Santalla
